Package controller

Class UpdateCustomerController

java.lang.Object
controller.UpdateCustomerController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class UpdateCustomerController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Author:
Hamza Yousaf This is the controller class for the "UpdateCustomer" view. It handles the business logic for updating a customer in the database.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the controller. Populates country combo box when the view is launched.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • populateCountries

      public void populateCountries() throws SQLException
      Populates the country combo box using data from the CountryDAO.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • setCustomer

      public void setCustomer(int customerId, String customerName, String address, String postalCode, String phone, Country country, FirstLevelDivision division)
      Sets the fields of the form with the selected customer's details. This method is invoked to pre-populate the form when updating an existing customer's information.
      Parameters:
      customerId - The unique ID of the customer being updated. This field is uneditable.
      customerName - The name of the customer being updated.
      address - The address of the customer being updated.
      postalCode - The postal code of the customer being updated.
      phone - The phone number of the customer being updated.
      country - The country of the customer, used to preselect the correct value in the country combo box.
      division - The first level division of the customer, used to preselect the correct value in the division combo box.

    • passCountry

      public void passCountry() throws SQLException
      Handles the selection of a country from the country combo box. Upon selection, this method triggers the population of the first-level divisions combo box based on the selected country.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • populateFirstLevelDivisions

      public void populateFirstLevelDivisions(int countryId) throws SQLException
      Fills the first-level divisions combo box with appropriate divisions based on the selected country. This method is invoked after a country is chosen by the user. It queries the database to retrieve the relevant first-level divisions associated with the given country.
      Parameters:
      countryId - The ID of the country for which first-level divisions are to be fetched.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • updateCustomer

      public void updateCustomer() throws SQLException
      Updates the customer's information in the database. Retrieves values from the form fields and sends them as an UPDATE statement to the database. Before updating, it checks if all inputs are filled using the inputCheck method. Upon successful update, a confirmation message is displayed.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • toCustomerGUI

      public void toCustomerGUI(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Navigates the user to the customer dashboard. This method is triggered when the corresponding button is clicked. It loads the Customer Dashboard view and displays it in the current stage.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by the button click, used to get the source stage for navigation.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • resetFields

      public void resetFields()
      Clears all input fields in the form. This allows the user to start a new entry from scratch without manually clearing each field.

    • inputCheck

      public boolean inputCheck()
      Validates whether all fields in the form are completed. Displays an error alert if any field is left empty.
      Returns:
      A boolean indicating whether all fields are filled. Returns true if all fields are complete, false otherwise.
